title.narrative: 6.1 CHILD-FRIENDLY SOCIAL PROTECTION

description.narrative: Output 6.1: Targeted national institutions have strengthened capacity to apply child sensitive budget and social protection systems, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 6. SOCIAL INCLUSIONNATIONAL INSTITUTIONS IMPLEMENT CHILD FOCUSED SOCIAL POLICY AND PROTECTION WITH EVIDENCE FOR EQUITY

participating-org.narrative: AMERICA MIDEAST EDUCATION AND TRAINING COMPANY INC

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Delivery of cash transfers through government system (beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)

Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
PF4C: Budget transparency, accountability and participation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 6.1: Targeted national institutions have strengthened capacity to apply child sensitive budget and social protectionsystems

description.narrative: GOJ initiated the process to develop national social protection and poverty reduction strategy. Key line ministries and non-government organizations staff capacities were strengthened to measure multidimensional child poverty. UNICEF continued to assist on average 56,000 most vulnerable girls and boys per month with child cash grant. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2018

title.narrative: of national ministries and institutions with strengthened capacities on child rights budgeting

baseline.value: 4 ministries with 116 staff trained (MoH, MoSD, MoL, MoE)

target.value: 2017:10 national ministries and institutions staff trained on child rights budgeting

actual.value: 2016:In total eight national ministries (Education, Health, Social Development, Labour, Justice and Awqaf and Islamic Affairs, Public Works and Housing and Higher Council for Youth) have staff trained on child rights budgeting.

title.narrative: of national ministries and institutions conducted child rights budget analysis and recommend specified policy interventions for children

baseline.value: Child rights budget analysis conducted in 4 ministries/institutions

target.value: 2017:Child rights budget analysis conducted in 10 ministries/institutions

title.narrative: Evidence based national dialogue to increase coverage and deliver integrated national social protection programmes (National Aid Fund, and Zakat Fund) that benefit disadvantaged and excluded girls, boys and families including humanitarian situation in Jordan

baseline.value: NAF and ZF Current coverage and delivery limited for disadvantaged and excluded girls, boys and families

target.value: 2017:NAF and ZF improved targeting, coverage, monitoring and evaluation systems and accountability to children and their families including humanitarian situation

actual.value: 2017:The unconditional Child Cash Grant programme assisted 56,000 girls and boys (on average) from 15,500 of the most vulnerable Syrian refugee families with US$ 28 per child per month.National Aid Fund assisted 2000 girls and boys with child grant from most vulnerable Jordanian families.

title.narrative: Framework for national social protection floor and action plan for its implementations developed

target.value: 2017:Evidence based national dialogue on establishing social protection floor in Jordan

actual.value: 2017:ILO has completed the costing and fiscal space analysis for social protection floor in Jordan. Universal child grant for all children 0 through 5 and education stipend for children for secondary education is included in the ‘Social Protection Floor' proposal.
